overview_of_class:
The goal of this course is to provide you with a context within which to understand the history of musical theatre while cultivating your own opinions about the art form and how it relates to society.
This course is a research based course. You will research and discuss topics weekly, followed by weekly presentations. These topics are assigned by era so that we may analyze and compare the material to the history of society. You will also apply your growing knowledge of musical theatre history and context to intelligently observe and engage in discussion of the thoughts and presentations of your peers within a structured setting. Throughout the course there will be group discussions, group research, independent research, group presentations and writing response to prompts, which will require critical thinking and self reflection. There will be weekly readings, weekly presentations and two papers due.

Please contact Matt Hawkins for permission numbers. matt.hawkins@northwestern.edu
